edu.uw.cs.cse461.util

Class IPFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uw.cs.cse461.util.IPFinder

  • public class IPFinder
extends Object
    Console implementation of a class that tries to determine "the IP address" of the machine we're running on. The problem is that "the IP address" isn't a well defined notion - there are likely to be many of them.

    This class deals with IPv4 addresses only.

    Author:
    zahorjan

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  IPFinder.IPChooser
      This class uses the interface iterator method below to apply a heuristic that tries to identify "the IP" for the machine we're running on.
      private static interface  IPFinder.NetworkInterfaceCallbackInterface
      Objects that can field callbacks from the NetworkInterfaceIterator method.
      private static class  IPFinder.NetworkInterfaceDumper
      A class that prints out the networking environment of the machine.

      • logInterfaces

        public static String logInterfaces()

      • _enumerateInterfaces

        private static void _enumerateInterfaces(IPFinder.NetworkInterfaceCallbackInterface callback)
        This method is the basic control flow to enumerate all network interfaces and then all IP addresses associated with each. Think of it as an iterator over the basic networking configuration data. It issues a callback to some object, provided as an argument, for each NetworkInterface and InetAddress.

        It's used for two things: to print out this information, and to apply a heuristic to try to identify which IP is "the IP" of the machine we're running on.

        Parameters:
        callback - Either a printing or an IP address selection object.
